summary: This is an email chain between attorney Suzanne Jaffe Bloom and federal prosecutors regarding a grand jury subpoena issued to an unnamed client. The emails discuss scheduling a meeting, holding the grand jury appearance in abeyance, and reference related civil cases involving Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.context: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP representing an unnamed client who received a grand jury subpoena from the SDNY. She is coordinating with prosecutors to schedule a meeting and confirm the adjournment of the grand jury appearance.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.context: Colleague of Suzanne Jaffe Bloom at Winston & Strawn LLP, copied on the email correspondence regarding the grand jury subpoena and meeting scheduling.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced indirectly as 'Mr. Epstein' in the context of related civil cases in federal court in Florida that are mentioned by the prosecutors.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the representation of an unnamed client who received a grand jury subpoena.
Suzanne Jaffe Bloom states she has been formally retained to represent the client in connection with the SDNY grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) issues a grand jury subpoena to an unnamed individual.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance (Adjourned)
events.description: The initial appearance date listed on the subpoena is adjourned and held in abeyance pending further discussions.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: A meeting is scheduled between defense attorneys Suzanne Jaffe Bloom, Johanna Rae Hudgens, and federal prosecutors.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: An unnamed individual received a grand jury subpoena from the SDNY dated July 5, 2019, and has retained Winston & Strawn LLP for representation.
The scheduled grand jury appearance for July 24, 2019, was adjourned and held in abeyance to allow for a potential voluntary interview.
Prosecutors referenced several related civil cases involving Jeffrey Epstein, including cases 15 Civ. 7433, 17 Civ. 616 (SDNY), and 08 Civ. 80736 (SDFL), as well as cases in Florida federal court.
The email chain includes an attached example of a standard proffer agreement, indicating discussions about a potential cooperation agreement.
The primary subject of the subpoena is redacted, but the context suggests it is a person connected to the Epstein investigation.
